ygData.subject: Re: off topic question
ygData.msgSnippet: The muddites drop more clay than ore
ygData.messageBody:
The muddites drop more clay than ore

Zach Heaven wrote:

> From: Zach Heaven <zheaven@...>
>
> If anyone on this list reads a vendor to you, they are misinformed. The only
> way to make pie-tins is through smithing or pottery. Being a master potter is
> a huge advantage for you, as you can make the pie tin and make the compass.
> That is what I will be doing tonight.
>
> When someone says "it's on the vendor next to the blue building in freeport"
> they are mistaken. Because you can buy the tin sketch (1pp and change) from
> the vendor to make the tin, but then most will just sell it back to the vendor
> since they are not in demand. Thus why you see it occasionally off a vendor,
> someone actually made that tin and sold it back.
>
> Your best bet is to become a master potter. Preferrable an Enchanter with
> Benevolence and Illusions so you can get bare base price on everything from
> jewelry to clay.
>
> Speaking of clay, I know muddites drop ore in Gorge, does anything drop clay?
>
> -Kryogen Katspaw
>
> --- Dave Duncan <deduncan19@...> wrote:
> > From: "Dave Duncan" <deduncan19@...>
> >
> > I've been a subscriber to the list for quite a while, but must have missed
> > this part. I understand that the main topic right now is finding combos for
> > the fishing pole, but I wanted to get off topic real quick. So, my goal is
> > to make compasses for my guild and I was wondering is there any place to buy
> > pie tins? I've mastered pottery just to make them, but it would be soooo
> > handy just to be able to buy them. Anyone know?
> >
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Litre Hosen
> > 22nd hump gnomish necromancer, Solusek Ro
> >
> > >
>
>
